planet.name: HD 219134 b
BD+56 2966 b
GJ 892 b
Gliese 892 b
HIP 114622 b
HR 8832 b
2MASS J23131692+5710059 b
PPM 41599 b
TYC 4006-1866-1 b
Gaia DR2 2009481748875806976 b
planet.description: The planetary system around HD 219134 was discovered independently by teams using HARPS-N and APF, who announced four-planet and six-planet solutions respectively. Spitzer observations allowed the discoverers to detect the transit of the innermost planet in front of the star making HD 219134 b the nearest known transiting planet to date.

planet.description: The planetary system around HD 219134 was discovered independently by teams using HARPS-N and APF, who announced four-planet and six-planet solutions respectively. Transits of the second planet were detected in 2017.

planet.description: HD 219134 with its four low-mass planets is the first result of the Rocky Planet Search program with HARPS-N on the Telescopio Nazionale Galileo in La Palma. This planet was designated HD 219134 d in the HARPS-N announcement.

planet.description: The planet candidate HD 219134 e was discovered by Motalebi et al. (2015). It was subsequently shown to be the same candidate as HD 219134 h from Vogt et al. (2015), and the latter name is now used for this planet.

planet.description: The planetary system around HD 219134 was discovered independently by teams using HARPS-N and APF, who announced four-planet and six-planet solutions respectively. In the HARPS-N solution, this planet was designated HD 219134 e and was assigned a shorter-period, more eccentric orbit.
